display_asset.caption: A commuter walks by a closed Metro station in the District of Columbia on Wednesday.

summaries.body: As a Metro shutdown sent Washington, D.C., commuters onto the streets, impatient travelers vented on social media.
Belgian police have identified a 35-year-old Algerian man who was killed during a counterterrorism raid the day before as having potential links to radical Islam.

display_asset.caption: The Cook County state’s attorney, Anita Alvarez, was plagued along the campaign trail for her role in the case of Laquan McDonald, a teenager who was shot 16 times in October 2014.

summaries.body: Anita Alvarez, a prosecutor derided for taking more than a year to charge a white Chicago police officer in the death of a black teenager, was defeated in Tuesday's primary.

display_asset.caption: Chris Rock, the host of the Oscars, joked that three children of Asian descent were the accountants from PricewaterhouseCoopers. About two dozen Asian members of the academy said they felt the joke was a slur.

summaries.body: “The obliviousness was actually shocking,” the actor George Takei said of the motion picture academy's apology over jokes made about Asians at the Oscars ceremony.

display_asset.caption: A train departed a Washington Metro station on Tuesday. The subway system will shut down on Wednesday for safety inspections.

summaries.body: The subway system in Washington, D.C., will shut down all day today to allow for safety inspections prompted by a fire earlier this week.
At least 15 people in Wisconsin have died since November from bacteria that cause blood infections. Health officials are struggling to find the source of the outbreak.

display_asset.caption: Officials with the United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement Homeland Security Investigations said in a statement that they had confiscated a “second century bodhisattva schist head.”
display_asset.credit: U.S. Immigration and and Customs Enforcement

summaries.body: For the second time in a matter of days, federal agents seized what they called an illicit antiquity that was scheduled to be sold during Asia Week in New York.
Amazon is seeking a patent for a system that would allow users to verify their identities with selfies instead of passwords.

display_asset.caption: About half of Elephant Rock, a natural stone formation in New Brunswick, Canada, crumbled on Monday. The tides that helped carve it out of the shoreline also played a role in its destruction.

summaries.body: The tides that helped carve Elephant Rock out of the shoreline in New Brunswick, Canada, also played a role in its destruction.
Dallas Seavey won his fourth Iditarod, finishing the Alaskan dog-sled race in record time, followed by his father.

display_asset.caption: Ninth-seeded Connecticut, above, which won the American Athletic Conference tournament last weekend, will face Colorado on Thursday in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

summaries.body: This year, there could be many N.C.A.A. tournament upsets that really won't be. In at least six men’s games in this year’s first round, the lower seed is the betting favorite.

display_asset.caption: Video image of a Fort Worth police officer pepper-spraying a group of motorcyclists Sunday.

summaries.body: A video appears to show a Texas police officer using pepper spray on passing motorcycle riders. The officer, who had pulled over a truck, is being investigated.

display_asset.credit: Robert Rausch for The New York Times

summaries.body: The U.S. just announced that you can travel to Cuba as an individual. Times editors and reporters answered questions on Facebook about the new rules.

display_asset.caption: Megan Hilty, center left, with Shoshana Bean in “Wicked” in 2005 at the Gershwin Theater.

summaries.body: "Wicked" has become one of only three shows to reach the $1 billion milestone at the Broadway box office. It's the fastest to get there, the show’s producers say.

display_asset.caption: Harrison Ford (right) as Indiana Jones in the 2008 film “Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull,” directed by Steven Spielberg.

summaries.body: Disney is set to bring back "Indiana Jones" with the actor Harrison Ford. The fifth installment of the adventure series is expected to be released in 2019.

display_asset.caption: President Obama invited the creator and star of the musical “Hamilton,” Lin-Manuel Miranda, to freestyle about all things governmental in the Rose Garden.

summaries.body: Lin-Manuel Miranda, creator of the musical "Hamilton," freestyled at the White House. He rapped about governmental topics on cards held up by the president.

display_asset.caption: A cell at the prison in Skien where Mr. Breivik has been serving his sentence since 2013.
display_asset.credit: Cornelius Poppe/Scanpix, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Anders Behring Breivik, the Norwegian extremist who killed 77 people, claims his confinement in a three-room prison suite with PlayStation amounts to torture.

display_asset.caption: Nausheen Rahman, being arraigned Monday on Staten Island, is charged with murder and concealment of a human corpse.
display_asset.credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times

summaries.body: A baby-killing case prompted gasps in a Staten Island court. Nausheen Rahman is said to have thrown her newborn in the trash so fast she did not realize the child was a girl.

display_asset.caption: A bomb disposal specialist at the scene of a car explosion in Berlin on Tuesday.

summaries.body: An explosion that destroyed a car and killed the driver in Berlin was likely caused by a bomb, police said.

display_asset.caption: The former Speaker of the House John Boehner was honored at the Lincoln Day Dinner in West Chester, Ohio on Saturday.
display_asset.credit: Greg Lynch/The Journal-News, via Associated Press

summaries.body: More than a dozen Republicans are on the ballot in Ohio to succeed former Speaker John A. Boehner in Congress.
An editorial in a Chinese newspaper points to Donald J. Trump’s candidacy as an example of the instability of democratic systems.

display_asset.caption: Michael Jackson performing in 1993, two years before he and Sony formed their joint venture.

summaries.body: Sony has agreed to pay Michael Jackson’s estate $750 million for its share of a joint venture formed with the pop star in 1995.

display_asset.caption: Samples of frames available in Eli Wilner’s app.

summaries.body: Eli Wilner, who frames priceless art, created an app that lets users choose a virtual copy from his inventory of museum-quality frames to apply to their photos.
Tests given to young Americans since the 1930s have shown a steady rise in anxiety and depression from generation to generation.
American Airlines recently pursued legal action against its Wi-Fi provider, Gogo, as its passengers increasingly expect more from in-flight connectivity.

display_asset.caption: Owen Labrie during his trial in 2015.

summaries.body: Prosecutors say Owen Labrie, an ex-student at an elite New Hampshire prep school who was convicted of a sexual offense, may have violated his curfew at least eight times.

display_asset.caption: Albert J. Daulerio, former editor in chief of Gawker Media.

summaries.body: A.J. Daulerio, a former editor of Gawker, said that he was being insincere when he said during a deposition that children over 4 were fair game for online sex tapes.

display_asset.caption: People surf on the wave of a tidal bore known as “Pororoca” in March 2015 during an annual festival in Sao Domingos do Capim, Brazil.

summaries.body: This week surfers will ride a wave in the Amazon. The Pororoca, a tidal bore, tumbles in from the ocean and up the river on a path of destruction. But surfers love it.

display_asset.caption: Arnold Demoski, 26, of Nulato, Alaska, who was charged with driving a snowmobile into two teams of Iditarod dog-sled racers on Saturday.

summaries.body: A snowmobile driver who was accused of colliding with mushers in the Iditarod dog-sled race in Alaska has apologized, saying that he had been drinking. One dog was killed.

display_asset.caption: Passengers huddled near an Amtrak train that derailed in southwest Kansas early Monday.

summaries.body: An Amtrak passenger train on its way to Chicago from Los Angeles came off the tracks in Kansas, sending more than 30 people to hospitals.
